summary:
As graduate and passionate biologist I have gained extensive experience in the scientific field of population biology. During my master I studied the genetic variation in Dutch populations of the critically endangered Tower Mustard (Arabis glabra). I looked at the effects of habitat fragmentation on genetic diversity and its implications for conservation and management of the species. This has given me valuable experience with molecular techniques such as microsatellites and AFLPs. In addition, I examined the effects of invasive animals on native species within the reserves of a non-governmental conservation organization (Natuurmonumenten). In doing so, I build a bridge between the scientific and practical side of nature management and I succeeded in integrating both disciplines in management advice. Furthermore, I worked as a teaching assistant at the University of Amsterdam where I taught statistics to first-year bachelor students. This work equipped me with a broad knowledge of statistical analysis of biological data.

I am currently working as a scientific researcher at Science4Nature. Within Science4Nature I have been able to continue my passion for biology and have worked on various genetic research projects. The qualities I have developed here are reflected in the successful completion of the various projects in which I have been involved. Besides my professional career, I have been active as a volunteer and player in various research projects. Here I have been able to stimulate my curiosity and use my experience and enthusiasm for the conservation of nature.

projects.title: Volunteer at Las Piedras Amazon Centre (Peru, 2019)
projects.description: Research on the distribution and behavior of critically endangered spider monkeys in the Peruvian Amazon.

projects.title: Participant of Taxon Expeditions (Borneo, 2017)
projects.description:
First citizen science project in the Maliau Basin (Malaysian Borneo) which led to the discovery and publication of five new beetle species.

Watch more:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wB-9_Japfns

publications.name: Schilthuizen, M., Seip, L.A., Otani, S., Suhaimi, J. & Njunjić, I. 2017. Three new minute leaf litter beetles discovered by citizen scientists in Maliau Basin, Malaysian Borneo (Coleoptera: Leiodidae, Chrysomelidae). Biodiversity Data Journal 5: e21947.

profile_positions.description:
Hands-on scientific research on wild populations of critically endangered plant species in the Netherlands for conservation purposes. This involves:

- Demographic and genetic research (microsatellite, AFLP, ITS-sequencing)
- Cross-pollination experiments in the field
- Analysis of genetic data
- Reporting
- Taking care of plants for restoration projects

Projects in which I have been involved:
- Genetic research on rabbit populations in the Dutch costal dunal area
- Research on the genetic diversity and seed set of Meadow thistle (Cirsium dissectum)
- Genetic research on Wild thyme (Thymus serpyllum) using AFLPs
- Genetic research on Bastard toadflax (Thesium humifisum) using microsatellites
- Phylogenetic research on Fragrant orchid (Gymnadenia conopsea) using ITS-sequencing
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Assisting first year students (Biology, Biomedical sciences, 
Beta Gamma, Psychology) in the statistical analysis of biological data, the theoretical part as well as their  practical skills in Excel, SPSS and R. In addition, I fulfilled the task of head assistant which includes: 

- Giving lectures
- Organization and structuring of the course content 
- Developing, preparing and adapting course material
- Coaching, managing and instructing teaching assistants
- Providing students with feedback on weekly assignments
- Primary contact in student communication
- Administration of student results

Related (additional) activities:
- Giving personal support in statistics (outside lectures)
- Provision of advice on statistical analyses within research projects
profile_positions.title: Education Assistant in Basic Statistics

profile_positions.description:
Exam training for high school students (VMBO/HAVO/VWO) in maths and biology. Other tasks included: 

- Supporting and motivating students in their learning environment
- Reporting on students' progress
- Communication with parents about student results
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the project was to rank the current leading electronic brands according to their efforts to use responsible tin in their electronic devices. By doing so, the aspiration was to encourage the companies to finally take their responsibility in the ongoing social and ecological issues that arise with tin extraction in Indonesia. In addition, my ultimate goal was to create awareness amongst consumers about the hidden story of only a small part in our daily used and beloved mobile phones. 

The tin ranking was published on the organisation's website and several national journals.
profile_positions.title: Voluntary Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Subject: Management of Invasive Alien Species (Fauna)

During this internship I have been working for the Dutch nature conservation organisation Natuurmonumenten. The aim of this study was to provide Natuurmonumenten recommendations on cost-effective policies for controlling invasive exotic animals within their reserves. Here, I challenged the difficult task to provide a link between scientific-based knowledge about exotic invasions and the more practical side of exotic animal control carried out in Dutch park management. At the end of the project, I succeeded to integrate both aspects into a management plan that now serves as a critical tool for action on invasive animal species. This experience enabled me to be familiar with the practical work in conservation management in general and, in particular, the decision making and policies of a Dutch nature organisation.
profile_positions.title: MSc Internship

company.name: Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics

profile_positions.company: Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics
profile_positions.description:
Subject: Genetic Variation in the Critically Endangered Plant Species Arabis glabra L. (Turritis glabra) as Revealed by Amplified Fragment Length Polymorphism (AFLP)

I have conducted this research internship within the Institution for Biodiversity and Ecosystem Dynamics (IBED). My research focused on the genetic variation in wild populations of the highly endangered plant species Arabis glabra (tower mustard). This project has equipped me with valuable practical experience in molecular lab work (e.g. DNA isolation, PCR amplification, AFLP analysis), population genetic structure analysis (e.g. STRUCTURE, AFLP-SURV), as well as population genetic data analysis (e.g. Arlequin, GenAlEx). The results of my study have made a significant contribution to the knowledge of genetic consequences of habitat fragmentation and its impact on the viability and decline of rare and endangered plant species. At the same time, this research gave me the opportunity to assess implications for effective strategies for the conservation of the species.
profile_positions.title: MSc Internship
